operations.description: Creates a new file in the database, saving the given content, filename, contentType, and extraData.

parameters.description: The mandatory content of the new file. This content is an InputStream.
parameters.name: content

parameters.description: The name of the new file.
parameters.name: filename

parameters.description: A JSON object that hold any information you want to store.
parameters.name: metadata

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of memory that will be allocated in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can be fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded by according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize.

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.name: streamingStrategy

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

operations.name: executeCommand

operations.description: Finds all documents that match a given query. If no query is specified, all documents of the collection are retrieved. If no fields object is specified, all fields are retrieved.

displayModel.summary: The optional query for finding documents

parameters.description: The optional query for finding documents. If unspecified, all documents are retrieved. It can be: {"field1": "value1"} Or contain operators: { "field1": { $gte: 1, $lt:  10 } }
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: Indicates the document used to sort the results
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Size of documents of each page to return
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Limit of documents to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The mime type of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputMimeType

parameters.description: The encoding of the payload that this operation outputs.
parameters.name: outputEncoding

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of instances that will be initially be allowed to be kept in memory in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize. Default value is 100 instances.

This is by how much will the buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full. Default value is 100 instances.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
This is the maximum amount of instances that will be kept in memory. If more than that is required, then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.name: streamingStrategy

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy

operations.name: listIndexes

operations.description:
Transforms a collection into a collection of aggregated groups, by applying a supplied element-mapping function to each element, that transforms each one into a key-value pair, grouping the resulting pairs by key, and finally reducing values in each group applying a suppling 'reduce' function.

Each supplied function is coded in JavaScript.

Note that the correct way of writing those functions may not be obvious; please consult MongoDB documentation for writing them.

parameters.description: the name of the collection to map and reduce
parameters.name: collectionName

parameters.description: a JavaScript encoded mapping function
parameters.name: mappingFunction

parameters.description: a JavaScript encoded reducing function
parameters.name: reduceFunction

displayModel.summary: Name of the output collection to write results

parameters.description: the name of the output collection to write the results, replacing previous collection if existed, mandatory when results may be larger than 16MB. If outputCollection is unspecified, the computation is performed in-memory and not persisted.
parameters.name: outputCollection

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

If the stream contains more data than can be fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded by according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize.

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

operations.description: Updates documents that matches the given query. If query is not specified, all documents are retrieved. If parameter multi is set to false, only the first document matching it will be updated. Otherwise, all the documents matching it will be updated.

parameters.name: collectionName

displayModel.summary: The query object used to detect the element to update

parameters.description: The query object used to detect the element to update. It can be: {"field1": "value1"} Or contain operators: { "field1": { $gte: 1, $lt:  10 } }
parameters.name: query

parameters.description: The object that will replace the one which matches the query.
parameters.name: contentToUpdate

parameters.description: If all or just the first document matching the query will be updated
parameters.name: multipleUpdate

displayModel.summary: Creates a new document when no one matches with the query criteria

parameters.description: If set to true, creates a new document when no document matches the query criteria. The default value is false, which does not insert a new document when no match is found.
parameters.name: upsert

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of memory that will be allocated in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can be fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded by according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize.

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.name: streamingStrategy

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

parameters.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

description.value: The maximum number of times a message can be redelivered and processed unsuccessfully before triggering process-failed-message
The secure hashing algorithm to use. If not set, the default is SHA-256.
Defines which strategy is used to identify the messages.
Whether to use a secure hash algorithm to identify a redelivered message
Defines one or more expressions to use to determine when a message has been redelivered. This property may only be set if useSecureHash is false.

parameters.description: The read concern option allows you to control the consistency and isolation properties of the data read from replica sets and replica set shards.
parameters.name: readConcern

parameters.description: Specifies the read preferences for this connection.
parameters.name: readPreference

parameters.description: Specifies, in seconds, how stale a secondary can be before the client stops using it for read operations.
parameters.name: maximumStalenessSeconds

parameters.description: If a replica set member or members are associated with tags, you can specify a tag set (array of tag specification documents) in the read preference to target those members.
parameters.name: readPreferenceTags

parameters.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

description.value: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute

parameters.name: expirationPolicy

parameters.description: Requests acknowledgment that the write operation has propagated to the specified number of mongod instances. You can write a number of instances n>0 or use a value from the list.
parameters.name: writeConcernAcknowledgement

parameters.description: This option specifies a time limit, in milliseconds, for the write concern. it is only applicable for Write Concern Acknowledgement values greater than 1
parameters.name: writeConcernTimeout

parameters.description: The Timeunit for the Write Concern Timeout.
parameters.name: writeConcernTimeoutTimeunit

externalLibraryModels.name: MongoDB Driver
externalLibraryModels.description: The Java MongoDB Driver that support connections to MongoDB Database

parameters.description: The server where your MongoDB instance is. You can set multiple servers.
parameters.name: serverAddresses

parameters.description: Specify the database name that you want to connecto to.
parameters.name: database

parameters.description: The username to use for authentication.
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The password to use for authentication. If the password is null or whitespaces only, the connector won't use authentication and username must be empty too.
parameters.name: password

parameters.description: The name of the replica set to connect to. The server Addresses list can be partial when using this parameter. This means that the user can set just one host on Server Addresses, but set this value and It will connect to the full cluster
parameters.name: replicaSetName

displayModel.summary: List of compressors to enable network compression for communication between this client and a mongod/mongos instance. If you specify multiple compressors, then the order in which you list the compressors matter as well as the communication initiator.

parameters.description: List of compressors to enable network compression for communication between this client and a mongod/mongos instance. If you specify multiple compressors, then the order in which you list the compressors matter as well as the communication initiator.
parameters.name: compressors

parameters.description: An integer that specifies the compression level if using zlib for network compression. 0 means No Compression, 1-9 are the compression levels, with 1 being the lowest compression level, and 9 the most compressions (and more processing time)
parameters.name: zlibCompressionLevel

parameters.description: The connection timeout; this is for establishing the socket connections (open). 0 is infinite.
parameters.name: connectionTimeout

parameters.description: The connection timeout unit.
parameters.name: connectionTimeoutTimeunit

parameters.description: The size of the latency window for selecting among multiple suitable MongoDB instances.
parameters.name: localThreshold

parameters.description: The local threshold Time Unit.
parameters.name: localThresholdTimeUnit

parameters.description: Specifies how long to block for server selection before throwing an exception.
parameters.name: serverSelectionTimeout

parameters.description: The server selection Time Unit.
parameters.name: serverSelectionTimeoutTimeUnit

parameters.description: The socket timeout. It is used for I/O socket read and write operations. 0 is default and infinite.
parameters.name: socketTimeout

parameters.description: The socket timeout unit.
parameters.name: socketTimeoutUnit

parameters.description: Enable retryable writes
parameters.name: retryWrites

parameters.description: The authentication Mechanism used for this connection
parameters.name: authenticationMechanism

description.value: A comma separated list of protocols enabled for this context.
A comma separated list of cipher suites enabled for this context.
Trust store configuration. If used client side, the trust store contains the certificates of the trusted servers. If used server side, it contains the certificates of the trusted clients.
The location (which will be resolved relative to the current classpath and file system, if possible) of the trust store.
The password used to protect the trust store.
The type of store used.

displayModel.example: jks, jceks, pkcs12 or other store type

description.value: The algorithm used by the trust store.
If true, no certificate validations will be performed, rendering connections vulnerable to attacks. Use at your own risk.
Key store configuration. The key store contains the keys of this server/client.
The location (which will be resolved relative to the current classpath and file system, if possible) of the key store.
The type of store used.

displayModel.example: jks, jceks, pkcs12 or other store type

description.value: When the key store contains many private keys, this attribute indicates the alias of the key that should be used. If not defined, the first key in the file will be used by default.
The password used to protect the private key.
The password used to protect the key store.
The algorithm used by the key store.

Uses the standard JVM certificate revocation checks, which depend on the certificate having the corresponding extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP), and the availability of revocation servers.
Only verify the last element of the certificate chain.
Try CRL instead of OCSP first.
Do not use the secondary checking method (the one not selected before).
Avoid verification failure when the revocation server can not be reached or is busy.

Uses a custom OCSP responder for certificate revocation checks, with a specific trusted certificate for revocating other keys. This ignores extension points (additional tags for CRLDP or OCSP) present in the certificate, if any.
The URL of the OCSP responder.
Alias of the signing certificate for the OCSP response (must be in the trust store), if present.
Local file based certificate revocation checker, which requires a CRL file to be accessible and ignores extension points (additional tags for CRLDP and OCSP) in the certificate.
The path to the CRL file.
